posts.author: TheSquid
posts.content:
I have spent quite a long time testing Cleric/Druid/Monk build ideas, and after several iterations leveled to high 30s on online and offline WoG, this is the one I like the most. I wanted to name him "wise guy" but there are already two (!) in the archives.
Like the Order of Jormungardr, he has two full divine DC spellbooks, but unlike OoJ he focuses on spells first and Dragon Shape only as backup. I think it's a different enough build that it deserves its own post. In any case, he is very strong and pleasant to play.

Features:
  • More than 150 high DC spells per day
  • Scribe Scrolls for even more spells
  • Dragon Shape with Cleric buffs
Potential problems:
  • Dispels
  • Spell Resistance
  • Late Dragon and Monk power

Commentary:
This is a dual caster with many spells/day with high DC. With +12 Wisdom, +4 Dexterity and mundane items (on WoG), he has:
+63 AB with a sling and 59 AC + dodge bonus.

In dragon shape:
+63 / +68 AB (the latter in roughly 2 out of 3 attacks) and 83 AC.

Spells per day (levels 1–9):
21 / 21 / 19 / 19 / 19 / 17 / 15 / 14 / 14
159 total. This dwarfs those measly 40-CHA Sorcerers who only get 96.

Example spellbook:
Level 1: 10x Grease, 11x Divine Favor
Level 2: 10x Ext. Grease, 10x Ext. Divine Favor, 1x Ext. Bless
Level 3: 9x Call Lightning, Darkfires/Ext. Aids/Prayers/NEPs/Dispel Magic
Level 4: 9x Flame Strike, 10x Hammer of the Gods
Level 5: 9x Emp. Call Lightning, 10x Ext. Divine Power
Level 6: 8x Stonehold, 9x Ext. Haste
Level 7: 7x Ext. Stonehold, 3x WoF, 5x Ext. Blade Barrier
Level 8: 3x Ext. AoV, 3x Sunburst, 8x Emp. Blade Barrier
Level 9: 6x SoV, 8x Implosion

Scrolls:
Buffs for Dragon Shape (Owl’s Wisdom and Insight, Barkskin etc.), SR, Improved Invis., Regenerate, Heal, Harm, Greater Sanctuary, WoF, Premonition,  Summon IX.

DCs:
Grease 33 / Call Lightning 35 / Flame Strike 36 / BB 38 / Sunburst 40 / SoV 41 (Reflex)
Hammer 36 / Stonehold 38 (Will)
Implosion 44 (Fortitude)

Recommended Playstyle:
Step 1. Cast your long-term buffs. Summon elementals and hit things with your sling.
Step 2. When you feel like it and there are a decent number of enemies around, run in like a madman, cast some Greases (they stack), some Stoneholds (they stack), some SoV (guess what? They stack). Proceed to place Blade Barriers on top of prone/held/stunned enemies. Cast any number of damage spells to taste.
Step 3. Is someone still alive? Harm them! Implode them!
Step 4. (optional) Cackle like a madman.
Step 5. (only at high level). Buff to the gills and turn into a dragon.

Weaknesses:
  • This is not a dragon build. Your dragon shape is by far not the strongest possible. Solution: it's still pretty strong.
  • You will get dispelled by anything and their aunts. Solution: rebuff, using scrolls if needed.
  • Anyone’s uncle with a tiny bit of spell resistance will resist your spells. Solution: hit them with your Cleric-empowered sling.
  • Your saves and AC are meh until you get that Monk level. Solution: play like a proper caster and keep your distance!
Similar builds: 
there are a couple Cleric/Druid builds out there, but the only one which pumps Wisdom is Kail Pendragon's (adapted by Valerfor) Order of Jormungandr. Thaxll'ssyllia has a funny one with no Dragon Shape (and low DCs) but Divine Might and Divine Shield to use with Elemental Shape: Buff of the Jungle.
I think this build is more fun than OoJ as I like to play casters, and that one feels like too focused on the lategame. It is definitely true that a dragon with IKD, Improved Crit and Blind Fight  is much stronger than one without, but you can’t have everything.
